name: kinetically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves or produces movement: Their work is devoted to creating mechanically or kinetically powered toys. He mixes kinetically precise explanations of judo throws and techniques with vivid narratives of classic fights.
More examplesFewer examplesNanoscale particles are more kinetically stable than larger particles, so they are less prone to break down or interact with other ingredients. The start-up is in the forefront of developing kinetically charged consumer electronics.The choreography is kinetically inventive and intriguing, with striking use of figures in silhouette.
